text: I have a JDBC request that takes about 15-20 seconds to execute and I only want to execute it once for my test plan so I put it in an IF controller with a condition based on a counter.  The IF controller evaluates the condition correctly and executes the JDBC request.  The problem is that the thread does not wait for a response to the JDBC request, it continues on to the next controller which uses data that is returned by the JDBC request but since the request has not returned and the data is not available the thread (and every thread that executes before the request returns) errors out.
